page.title: 01INTRODUCTION:LANDSCAPE
page.content: Berwick is a small market town set at the estuary of the R.Tweed.It is approximately 60 miles from a major city - Newcastle to the south and Edinburgh to the north.The town is set in a rural area dominated by mixed farming in the Merse of the Tweed.It is the focus of much of the E.Borders. The population of the Town is about 12500 and has remained relatively stable for many years. There are many buildings of historical importance in the Town.The better examples have been protected by being declared as listed buildings.The Town has a good name for preserving and restoring old buildings including the Barracks (museum for the King's Own Scottish Borderers) and the Quay Walls (including the Customs House). Being remote,Berwick has its own culture,traditions and even dialect.
